sections.title: Disabling UEFI Secure Boot
sections.content: To disable Secure Boot, set the supervisor password in the BIOS settings. Then you should be able to disable Secure Boot and boot Arch.

sections.title: Changing SATA mode to AHCI
sections.content: To change SATA mode to AHCI, in BIOS settings navigate to the Main tab. If you do not see SATA Mode settings press Ctrl+s and navigate tabs forwards and backward. SATA Mode option should now appear.

sections.title: Kernel boot parameters
sections.content:
The following parameters can be added to boot arguments as explained in Kernel parameters:

- acpi_backlight=video to enable backlight setting from keyboard function keys
- acpi_osi=Linux to enable multimedia special function keys
- pci=nocrs to discard pci ACPI informations, may fix boot problems
- i915.enable_fbc=1 to enable framebuffer compression (power saving)
- snd_rn_pci_acp3x.dmic_acpi_check to enable internal microphones
- usbcore.quirks=2386:433b:bk to enable touchscreen (2386:433b is the ID for the touchscreen from lsusb)

sections.title: Kernel modules parameters
sections.content:
In kernels after linux-5.10, audio with SOF (Sound Open Firmware) from Intel is fully working (speakers, jack, internal and external mics) with the following setup:

```
/etc/modprobe.d/swift5.conf
```

```
options snd_sof_intel_hda_common hda_model=alc255-acer
```
